entries.content: Use questions to understand the prospect's underlying reason for hesitation or stating they are 'not interested'.
If asked 'Is this about recruitment?', respond with 'Well, if I told you it was, would you still hang up?' to diagnose their attitude.
Acknowledge the prospect's emotional state (e.g., frustration, upset) when they show resistance or push back.
Offer the prospect an easy way out when facing resistance to test their true level of disinterest or frustration.
When facing resistance or upset: 'I get the feeling I've upset you or you're angry with me. What have I done?'
When facing resistance: 'If you want, I don't mind leaving. It's up to you, what do you want to do?'
entries.notes: Offers an easy exit, tests commitment.

entries.content: Don't be pushy; trying to force a prospect makes them recoil.
Position the proposed next step (meeting) as a diagnostic exploration to see if there's a fit, not a sales pitch.
entries.notes: Reduces pressure when prospect is hesitant.

entries.content: Suggest meeting to 'explore whether or not you have a problem I can fix.'
Be okay with a prospect saying no; not everyone is a good fit or needs what you offer right now.

focus_area: Handling "Not Interested": Probe softly, diagnose if disinterest or timing
